text: Head to the Vortex of Genesis

title: Mission Description
content: The battle withNikadorends with the Chrysos Heirs' victory. We return toOkhemato rest and recover. Together, we will witness the return of theTitan's Coreflame and the start of the Coreflame's trial.

text: Within Amphoreus , at ( Trailblazer )'s private bath chamber...

speaker: Mem
line: Good thing you're finally up! Or that Giant 's light is going to give you a sunburn!

speaker: Dan Heng
line: They've been this excited for a while now... What did you feed them?

text: More like they snuck food themself.

children.speaker: Mem
children.line: Hmph, really now? I wouldn't do something like that!

children.speaker: Mem
children.line: Hmm... but come to think of it, I don't remember when the last time I ate something was...

text: They don't seem to need food.

children.speaker: Mem
children.line: Says who! I'm still a... a cute and tiny animal, alright!

children.speaker: Mem
children.line: Hmm? But come to think of it... I don't remember when the last time I ate something was...

speaker: Dan Heng
line: ...Forget it. You can skip the translation. I can somehow tell that none of that chatter's meaningful.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: It's almost time. The Chrysos Heirs should be finishing up their preparations at the Vortex of Genesis.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Let's go witness the Coreflame's return when you're ready.

text: Wait for Phainon to start the Coreflame's trial
(Head up the stairs towards the basin)

speaker: Trinnon
line: "O majesty of the twelve Titans, pillars of the world—"

speaker: Trinnon
line: "We seek your divinity, to mend the rifts of the world—"

speaker: Trinnon
line: "Fill our bodies with blood of gold, till we wither in willing service to the prophecy..."

speaker: Aglaea
line: Your guests are here, Phainon. We can begin the ritual now.

speaker: Castorice
line: Lord Mydei isn't here yet...

speaker: Phainon
line: It's fine, Miss Castorice. He spoke to me already.

speaker: Phainon
line: I told him that he should be nursing his wounds, and that he shouldn't be worrying about all this comrade's once-in-a-lifetime ascension ritual stuff.

speaker: Phainon
line: So, I'm ready to begin.

speaker: Aglaea
line: Teacher, show him the way forward.

speaker: Trinnon
line: Despite the myriad dark and endless nights that have gone by, the guidance of the prophecy is nevertheless as clear and bright as the first ray of dawn.

speaker: Trinnon
line: Overthrow the gods, it declared.

speaker: Trinnon
line: Restore the Coreflames, it declared.

speaker: Trinnon
line: Bear the divine authority, it declared.

speaker: Trinnon
line: Forge miracles, it declared.

speaker: Trinnon
line: O prophecy, forgive us for this late tribute. We Chrysos Heirs have striven to start the Flame-Chase Journey anew over these myriad nights. The seeds we sowed have finally yielded a good harvest.

speaker: Trinnon
line: The seventh Coreflame needed for the miracle, that once belonged to the great Lance of Fury, Nikador , shall now be returned by an elected hero of the Chrysos Heirs: an upstanding citizen, a valiant warrior, and a noble soul.

speaker: Trinnon
line: Please step forward, Phainon of Aedes Elysiae .

speaker: Trinnon
line: Recite with us :

speaker: Trinnon & Phainon
line: ▶ ▶ "O majesty of the twelve Titans, pillars of the world—"

speaker: Trinnon & Phainon
line: ▶ ▶ "We seek your divinity, to mend the rifts of the world—"

speaker: Trinnon & Phainon
line: ▶ ▶ "Fill our bodies with blood of gold, till we wither in willing service to the prophecy..."

speaker: Trinnon
line: Surrender the Coreflame, Chrysos Heir.

speaker: Phainon
line: The Lance of Fury 's constellation is illuminated...

speaker: Phainon
line: Why is the Vortex this silent? Was it also like that in the past?

speaker: Aglaea
line: Patience, Phainon. Do not make us question this decision.

speaker: Castorice
line: Lord... Gnaeus ?

speaker: Trinnon
line: I'm afraid he is not the person you know, Castorice. That is a manifestation of the prophecy, an echo of the Titan's divinity. It is here to examine the Titan's successor.

speaker: Divine Echo
line: (Titan's murmurs)

speaker: Trinnon
line: "Mortal who wishes to inherit my divine authority..."

speaker: Trinnon
line: "Your strength and character have been thoroughly tested..."

speaker: Divine Echo
line: (Titan's murmurs)

speaker: Trinnon
line: "Yet your will wavers..."

speaker: Trinnon
line: "If you are to inherit Nikador 's relentless fight against the unspeakable black tide..."

speaker: Divine Echo
line: (Titan's murmurs)

speaker: Trinnon
line: "You must accept a trial of divinity..."

speaker: Trinnon
line: "Prove that you possess an indestructible will... And vanquish the fears deep in your heart..."

speaker: Phainon
line: Vanquish... the fears in my heart?

speaker: Phainon
line: So be it. No matter what obstacles you plan to put in my way, I'm ready to overcome them.

speaker: Phainon
line: For our prophesied tomorrow, I will become the god Amphoreus needs.

speaker: Divine Echo
line: (Titan's murmurs)

speaker: Trinnon
line: "Come with me, Phainon of Aedes Elysiae..."

speaker: Phainon & Trinnon
line: ▶ ▶ "...In fear, you shall abandon your mortal body, and in suffering, be reborn as a god."

speaker: Phainon
line: Wait for my return, my friends.

speaker: Castorice
line: Lord Phainon... is gone?

speaker: Aglaea
line: He has stepped onto the battlefield to fight a campaign that can only be won by him alone.

speaker: Aglaea
line: All we can do is wait... and have faith.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: What a... mysterious ritual. Is there really nothing we can do but wait?

speaker: Dan Heng
line: I don't know about the rest of them, but I don't like to just sit by and wait for my fate to be decided.

speaker: Aglaea
line: Phainon steers his own fate.

speaker: Aglaea
line: If he can conquer his fear and return as a demigod, we will be one step closer to the miracle that the prophecy promised.

text: You have a lot of faith in him.

children.speaker: Aglaea
children.line: ...That would mean his time hasn't come yet. And that there is a more arduous mission for him to see through.

speaker: Aglaea
line: You must have noticed by now. Every Chrysos Heir here bears... a flaw of sorts. Be it the curse of immortality, or the constant erosion of their humanity, or...

speaker: Aglaea
line: But not Phainon. He is a Chrysos Heir without flaw, a perfect vessel for divinity.

speaker: Aglaea
line: There will come a day when he leads everyone — everyone we have left — through the gates of the miracle.

speaker: Aglaea
line: Phainon steers his own fate.

speaker: Aglaea
line: There will come a day when he leads everyone — everyone we have left — through the gates of the miracle.

speaker: Trinnon
line: Zzz... Zzz...

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Looks like she fell asleep. Presiding over this ritual must take quite a toll.

speaker: Trinnon
line: Snowy ... zzz... will succeed...

speaker: Trinnon
line: Zzz... Zzz...

speaker: Trinnon
line: Snowy... zzz... will succeed...

speaker: Castorice
line: I pray you truly are prepared, Lord Phainon.

children.speaker: Castorice
children.line: I spoke at length with Lord Phainon before. There was hesitation in his words.

children.speaker: Castorice
children.line: Yes, there was hesitation in his words.

speaker: Castorice
line: The manifestation of the prophecy must have seen this. It saw Lord Phainon's heart wavering.

speaker: Castorice
line: Wherever he is, whatever he is fighting, I pray he makes it through this test.

speaker: Castorice
line: Wherever he is, whatever he is fighting, I pray he makes it through this test.

speaker: Mydei
line: Still too late, huh...

speaker: Mydei
line: The constellation of the Lance of Fury is already illuminated. That must mean...

speaker: Castorice
line: The Coreflame has been surrendered, but Lord Phainon's test isn't over yet.

speaker: Castorice
line: The prophecy sent an ambassador. They acknowledged Lord Phainon's strength and character, but had doubts about his strength of will.

speaker: Castorice
line: He must conquer his fear and prove himself to the prophecy.

speaker: Mydei
line: ...I was right to be worried.

speaker: Mydei
line: I want to formally thank you, outsiders. Were it not for your aid, our campaign against Nikador would have been a hundred times more arduous.

text: Isn't it nice to be polite?

children.speaker: Mydei
children.line: Kremnoans revere strength and military might, but that does not mean we lack etiquette.

children.speaker: Mydei
children.line: You are asking for a reward? Not a problem.

children.speaker: Mydei
children.line: Kremnoans revere strength and military might, but that does not mean we lack etiquette.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Mydei, what do you mean when you said you were "worried"?

speaker: Mydei
line: They don't know yet?

speaker: Mydei
line: That guy... has always been tormented by his past.

speaker: Mydei
line: I may not be the right person to tell you about him, but you must know his past if you are to continue fighting alongside Phainon.

speaker: Castorice
line: Lord Mydei... please allow me.

speaker: Mydei
line: Hm... Very well.

speaker: Castorice
line: Before he was chosen by the prophecy, Lord Phainon had everything taken away from him: his home, his family, his close friends... Everything he once swore to protect.

speaker: Castorice
line: He became a hollowed shell in his youth, and the blazing flames of vengeance were the only thing sustaining him.

speaker: Castorice
line: The prophecy gave him a new mission, granting him a new life as a Chrysos Heir. But which is more important to him: his new mission or his desire for revenge?

speaker: Castorice
line: I'm afraid only he knows... No, perhaps he himself is still struggling to get to an answer.

speaker: Mydei
line: I acknowledge his strength, but... fear is something not even the sharpest of swords can cut through.

speaker: Mydei
line: I hope you've toughened your resolve, Deliverer...

speaker: Mydei
line: ...Only a will as tough as stone can shatter the darkest nightmares.
Hmm...

speaker: Young Phainon
line: Is something wrong?
Mmm...?

speaker: Young Phainon
line: Ugh, don't keep me in suspense. Come on, tell me already. What did you see?
Haha, I just wanted to get a reaction out of you. Alright, I'll tell you.
...This card is the Deliverer.

speaker: Young Phainon
line: Deliverer...? What does that mean?
Uh... The interpretation is really long. Maybe I should just skip it.

All you need to know is, this card means... you'll be a hero worshiped by all! You will protect this world and save lots and lots of people from scary enemies with your sword! Do you like the sound of that?

speaker: Young Phainon
line: But...
What's the matter? This is a good card!

speaker: Young Phainon
line: But I don't want to be everyone's hero! I just want to stay in this village with everyone I know.

speaker: Young Phainon
line: Grandpa and grandma said the outside world is full of bad people. That's why they're always at war... Who wants to save bad people like them! I can be a hero, but only our village's little hero!
Haha...
Well, little hero... If the day comes for us to say goodbye to Aedes Elysiae, could you become a Deliverer then?

speaker: Young Phainon
line: Do I... have to leave the village?
Mm-hmm. If something like that happens, someone will have to save the world.

speaker: Young Phainon
line: Then... Then I'll...
Haha, I'm just teasing you. Don't worry. Aedes Elysiae is a peaceful place. Bad people won't reach us here.
Are you going home already...? If you're not in a hurry, should we go play with the fairies again?

speaker: Young Phainon
line: Fairies! Okay! I love playing with them! Hmph, I'll win back the wooden sword I lost to them!
Heehee! Look at how excited that got you. Let's go then.
May this world never have need for a Deliverer.

text: Some system hours ago, aboard the Astral Express ...

speaker: Himeko
line: Pom-Pom , have you prepared our meals already?

speaker: Pom-Pom
line: Of course, the food's ready! March isn't feeling well, so Pom-Pom has specially prepared the conductor's special bland meal that'll be easy on her stomach.

speaker: Pom-Pom
line: Can you bring it to her, Himeko?

speaker: Himeko
line: Gladly. Why don't we also get her a—

speaker: Pom-Pom
line: Nuh-uh! No coffee when she's already feeling unwell!

speaker: Himeko
line: Heh... I guess you're right.

speaker: Himeko
line: March? I'm coming in, okay?

children.text:
(ObtainShadow of Remembrance×1,To All Things Strifeful×1)
(Obtain a strand of Nameless Recollection forAs I've Written)
In that dawn-kissed city-state, a hero from the outlands became one of the Flame-Chasers. Inspired by the journey, they recorded their tales in the pages of a book.

text: (Investigate March 7th's bed on the Astral Express Passenger Cabin, optional)
Curled up in the clear ice, the young girl remains silent with her eyes fixed shut.
Although the ice is not cold to the touch, there is something particularly saddening about seeing a young girl who is normally so full of life fall into complete silence.
A number of thin sheets of ice have shackled the unconscious March 7th to her bed. The once warm bedroom is now permeated with a bitter cold.
The young girl lays silent and flawless in the ice... Just as she did back when she was drifting through space.
